{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3345541,"name":"Mitchell Gresham","username":"mitch.gres","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mitch.gres/{size}/163055_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-27T18:28:43.855Z","cooked":"

Hey Everyone!

We had some issues at our last regional competition where a motor wasn’t connected and we wasted some valuable time going through other known issues whenever it was just an unplugged motor. Does anyone know a way that in the code that we might check whether the motor is connected or not. I know that with other motors people have used functions such as .getFirmware( ) to see if it’s connected, but does anyone already have a solution to this issue that doesn’t include using current?

Thanks again!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-03-27T18:28:43.855Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":16,"reads":163,"readers_count":162,"score":112.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":460372,"topic_slug":"ensuring-neo-vortex-connected","display_username":"Mitchell Gresham","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50754,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/ensuring-neo-vortex-connected/460372/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3345589,"name":"Gus B","username":"Beanbean1706","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/beanbean1706/{size}/226316_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-27T19:11:11.406Z","cooked":"

Do you mean a method for checking mid-match or just during at home or in your pit troubleshooting?

Whether on the field, tethered, or on wifi, you should see CAN errors if the motor doesn’t have power or if CAN is disconnected

If just for troubleshooting, you can always use a USB-c cable, plug into the spark flex, and see if rev hardware client recognizes it and see if you can give the motor commands.

What specifically do you mean is “not connected”? Power disconnected, CAN?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-03-27T19:11:11.406Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":134,"readers_count":133,"score":31.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":460372,"topic_slug":"ensuring-neo-vortex-connected","display_username":"Gus B","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52632,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 1706 Build/CAD Alum"},"post_url":"/t/ensuring-neo-vortex-connected/460372/2","custom_user_title":"FRC 1706 Build/CAD Alum","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3345664,"name":"Mitchell Gresham","username":"mitch.gres","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mitch.gres/{size}/163055_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-27T20:41:01.856Z","cooked":"

A method of checking mid-match that we can access from the code. So for instance I saw some people on other motors call a function like .getFirmware( ) and if it’s null that means that motor is disconnected and therefore they can either display it to the driver via Shuffleboard (which is what we’re trying to do) or actually take measures to keep driving despite it.

Thanks.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-03-27T20:41:01.856Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":90,"readers_count":89,"score":23.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":460372,"topic_slug":"ensuring-neo-vortex-connected","display_username":"Mitchell Gresham","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":52632,"username":"Beanbean1706","name":"Gus B","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/beanbean1706/{size}/226316_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50754,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/ensuring-neo-vortex-connected/460372/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3346189,"name":"Gus B","username":"Beanbean1706","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/beanbean1706/{size}/226316_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-28T13:56:01.779Z","cooked":"

I’m not personally aware of any methods like that but I’m also not a programmer for my team. If you know the ID of the Spark Flex, you can look for timeout errors on the driver station mid-match. Although, imo it’d be better to track down the source of the issue than implement a workaround. In what way is the motor unplugged? Is it a loose connection at the pdh, in the controller, or CAN? A simple loose connection Should be pretty easy to fix
